snippet: The Office of National Drug Control Policy announced it will spend $2.5 million to hire coordinators across 15 states to focus on the treatment, rather than the punishment, of addicts.
abstract: Office of National Drug Control Policy  says it will budget $2.5 million  to combat surge in heroin abuse in Northeast; will hire public safety and public health coordinators in five specific areas; program will focus on treatment rather than punishment of addicts.
lead_paragraph: The Office of National Drug Control Policy announced it will spend $2.5 million to hire coordinators across 15 states to focus on the treatment, rather than the punishment, of addicts.
